column1: Lothron was an Elvish name for the fifth month of the year. Lothron comes from the Sindarin language
column2: and in the Third Age the name was used only by the Dúnedain. Most other calendars in Middle-earth at that time used the Quenya equivalent
column3: which was Lótessë. Both these names come ultimately from the Elvish root-word lot(h)
column5: and refer to the springtime blossoming associated with this month.
